availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James David Scaff (Graves County shoemaker and prov govt conv rep)

body.p: Graves County, Kentucky, shoemaker. Kentucky native. Married to Caroline F. Scaff. Father of Quintina Scaff and John B. Scaff. Resident of Graves County in 1850. Shoemaker in Graves County in 1860. Member of the convention of the provisional government held at Russellville in November 1861. Shoemaker in Graves County in 1863.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Graves County, District 1, p. 464A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Graves County, Mayfield, p. 341-2.
Tennth Manuscript Census of the United States (1880), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Graves County, Dukeom, p. 407B.
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records (Provost Marshal General's Bureau; Consolidated Enrollment Lists, 1863-1865), NARA RG 110, 1st Congressional District Volume 2 of 3, Graves County, Kentucky, June 1863, p. 718 of 753 on microfilm, (accessed via Ancestry.com).
Tennessee Death Records, 1908-1958; Roll Number: 28, Weakley County Deaths, File no. 160, (Tennessee State Library and Archives; Nashville, Tennessee, accessed through ancestry.com on November 5, 2019), p. 191 of 382 on microfilm (accessed via Ancestry.com).
